#Text=Chapter 9
#Text=By the time Mrs. Stogbuchner came out to the playground to call her class , Baartock had almost forgotten how hungry he was .
#Text=He had found Jason and they had raced four times , and Baartock had won three times .
#Text=Then several other boys had joined in , and they 'd played tag .
#Text=That was a whole new game for Baartock .
#Text=He liked being ' it ' , then he could do the chasing .
#Text=When he was ' not it ' , he could run faster than any of the other boys , so they did n't try to chase him at all .
#Text=They went back into the classroom , and all the children went to their seats and got out their pencil boxes .
#Text=Baartock was horrified to discover that his pencil box was missing .
#Text=It was n't on the table where he 'd left it .
#Text=It was n't in the drawer at his place at the table .
#Text=It was his brand-new pencil box and he had n't even used the crayons yet , and now it was gone .
#Text=He did n't see it anywhere .
#Text=" Hello .

#Text= I 'm Mrs. Pangle , Timmy 's mother . "

column1: #Text=She pointed at one of the boys at the next table .
#Text=" I come in two afternoons a week .

#Text= If you 're looking for your box , I put it in your cubby . "

column1: #Text=" Where cubby ? "
#Text=He did n't know that he had a cubby , but if that was where his box was , he wanted to find it .
#Text=" It 's right over here . "
#Text=Mrs. Pangle led him to the back of the room , and stopped near the door going outside .
#Text=" Here you are , " she said pointing .
#Text=" This is your cubby . "
#Text=There , just as she had said , was his missing pencil box .
#Text=He picked it up and held it , almost afraid that he might lose it again .
#Text=" My cubby ? " he asked .
#Text=" That 's right .
#Text=He remembered what Mrs. Jackson said that humans say when only one gives something .
#Text=" Thank you , " he said .
#Text=" You 're welcome , Baartock .
#Text=" This one is yours . "
#Text=There were cards over each hook , and there was a mark on one that he recognized .
#Text=That must be his hook .
#Text=" You 'd better get back to your seat now .
#Text=" You 're supposed to make letters on the lines that look just like the ones they 've made . "
#Text=Baartock looked at the papers , then opened his box and got out his crayons .
#Text=" No , you 're supposed to use your pencil , " Jason said , seeing what Baartock was holding .
#Text=Baartock looked around and saw than none of them were using crayons .
#Text=He had wanted to make colored marks , but they were all using long yellow sticks instead .
#Text=He had n't used one of those before .
#Text=He put away his box of crayons , and got out his yellow stick .
#Text=He tried to use his the way all the children were , but it would n't make any marks on the paper .
#Text=The girl sitting across the table started giggling .
#Text=She had been watching him .
#Text=" You have to sharpen it , " she said .
#Text=" The pencil sharpener is on Mrs. Stogbuchner 's desk . "
#Text=Baartock got up and walked up to the desk .
#Text=He looked all over the desk , but he did n't see anything to sharpen the stick with .
#Text=There was n't a knife , or any kind of blade .
#Text=Mississtog-Buchner was helping a girl at one table and Mississpangel was helping a boy in the back of the classroom .
#Text=He just stood there looking at the desk and waited .
#Text=" Yes , Baartock , what do you need ? "
#Text=Mrs. Stogbuchner had finished with the girl and saw him just standing at her desk .
#Text=Baartock was n't sure just what to say , so he held up the pencil instead .
#Text=" Do you need some help with the pencil sharpener ? " she asked .
#Text=Several children in the front of the class started snickering .
#Text=" All right , get back to your work , " she said to them as she came over to help him .
#Text=" This is the pencil sharpener , " she said , and taking the pencil from his hand , " and this is how to use it . "
#Text=She put the pencil in a hole in a little box and started working the little crank on the side .
#Text=She pulled the pencil out of the box , and it had a point .
#Text=" That 's how you do it .
